name: Amora Hotel Jamison Sydney

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My partner and I spent three wonderful nights at the Amora Jamison and we could not fault any aspect of our stay.The room was spotless, the bed was so comfortable and the bathroom very modern. We would highly recommend this accomodation to all our friends and family. The staff were Excellent, Friendly and the doorman was very well mannered and polite.Room service was five star. We have stayed in many hotels in Sydney and this one rated the best all round for us. In future we will only stay at Amora..Thankyou to all staff!!!!!! keep doing such a great job. We will be back soon
reviews.title: very friendly place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a nice hotel in a good location - it's an easy walk to the Harbour Bridge, the rocks and Opera House. The rooms are large, and the bathrooms are amazing.
reviews.title: Nice hotel

reviews.text: We got a really good deal on the hotel by doing various web-searches.
reviews.title: Great Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I found this hotel to be excellent. I booked it as a Wot Hotel on wotif so I got a great rate.
reviews.title: Great Hotel and Location

reviews.text: I arrived late at night and found check in easy and the staff were friendly for that time of night. The room was a good size but not huge. Great bathroom with bath and quality products. Has everything other 5 star hotels has but doesn't quite seem 5 star.
reviews.title: Good if you get a cheaper price

reviews.text: I thought this was a great hotel...and in a great location. The hotel rooms looked like they had just been redone b/c it was new and sophisticated. The location is good as it's in the CBD...across the street from a great restaurant and bar...and within walking distance of the circular quay and harbour. The only thing to warn about is their taxi service...it can take up to 15 minute to get a taxi...so I recommend calling ahead.
reviews.title: Great Boutique Hotel

reviews.text: I can highly recommend the Rydges Jamison as a great choice to stay in the Sydney CBD.
reviews.title: Great Choice in Sydney CBD!

reviews.text: The hotel is located close to George Street, within an easy walk to the great shops and restaurants of the historic "Rocks" district, Circular Quay, the Harbour Bridge and the Opera House and just two streets walk from Wynyard station to which you can catch an Airportlink train directly from the International and Domestic airport terminals for far less than the cost of a cab fare - too easy! The staff were friendly and helpful and the room itself was very stylish. It reminded me of a sophisticated bachelor pad. A great bathroom, with a large shower and a separate bath, which is far nicer than the shower/bath combinations found in most hotels. I also found the hotel to be very quiet, which was a pleasant surprise. The pillows and the bed were also very comfy. I would certainly stay there again on my next trip to Sydney.
reviews.title: Great hotel in great location
Disappointing hotel - not recommended
reviews.text: We stayed here for 4 nights and would definately recommend it. The hotel is in a great location for all city centre attractions - 5 mins to circular quay and the rocks and 10 mins to darling harbour. Staff were firendly, spread of food in for breakfast was 1st class for a restaurant of this size. Rooms were clean and modern - only slight disappointment is that the bathrooms are ultramodern to the extent that they are almost a bit clinical but this is purely down to personal taste. If you're staying in sydeny stay here

It is an anomaly that this hotel is rated so highly - and not because of any random and easily repairable bad experience (such as poor service or bad meals). My low rating stems from fundamental systematic errors in this hotel including:
reviews.title: Believe the reviews on this downtown gem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed over the weekend with my wife on a package deal that included 2 course dinner for 2 and full buffet breakfast. The value was excellent, room was clean and comfortable. The service of the reception staff, door men (there were heaps), and the wait person at the Charr restaurant was superb. Location was perfect, and we walked to shopping, to the Rocks, as well as to a concert at the opera house. Travelled to/from the hotel via train with the underground station literally next door. I would definitely stay here again, and next time try the pakage deal with seafood buffet dinner!
reviews.title: Great value, excellent service and location

reviews.text: Our stay at the Amora Hotel in Sydney was comfortable and very nice. It is located in the Central Business District, and it was very convenient to dining and train travel. We were treated very well.
reviews.title: Luxury and service

reviews.text: Booked through Wotif. When I turned up at reception was greeted very professionally and got a room upgrade. I specified a quiet room and was told that the room I had been given would be. A great start and I was impressed. The room was large but a bit tired in presentation.Old TV, ordinary furnishings Unfortunately my definition of quiet must be different to others as there was a very annoying loud humming noise coming from outside the room. I asked to be moved to a quieter room which was quickly accommodated. The location was great, especially as I enjoy dining out at Tthe Rocks. Can highly recommend Sailor Thai upstairs for a meal. I travel to Sydney each week on business and so far have not found teh best value for money hotel in the CBD. I would not stay at this hotel again.
reviews.title: Over rated, tired in need of a revamp

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in this hotel after a flight from the USA. We were tired and the bed was comfortable but the mattress protector didn't fit the bed nor did the doona cover. They added another mattress protector to cover the top of the mattress at 11 oclock at night when we complained. The grout in the shower and around the bath looked stained and the frame around the air conditioner was dirty. The carpet was also a bit grubby. Wouldn't call this room 5 star at all.
reviews.title: Not 5 star

reviews.text: I've stayed at the Amora for business a few times. The location is great and easy to access from the airport by taking the train.
reviews.title: A great hotel in a great location - pity about the food

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed five nights at the amora as part of our holiday. The location was great and approx 5 minutes walk to most of the tourist attractions inc Circle Quays. It has the added bonus of being 20 mtrs from George Street from where you can hop on any bus including the tourist sightseeing bus to get around the city. We were allocated a room on the 5th floor which was adequate in size, modern and clean. There was however a shortage of storage space including drawers for emptying our suitcases into. Room service was lapse at times and we would find ourselves returning to the room at 4-30pm to find the room still had not been made up. An ice bucket from our room layout side the door for collection for two days prior to it being collected. Staff especially the concierge and door staff were helpful and pleasant. The main problem we experienced was from the building working from the ajacent building.Each morning we would be woken at 7am to the sound of a pneumatic drill lifting the paving on the ajacent open foyer area. This problem was exasperated by being on a low floor. Overall a good hotel in a good location.
reviews.title: Good Tourist Location, pleasant hotel

likes.disliked: — Adequate sized rooms and close vicinity to an ajacent building rennovation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: uk trip advisor member.
reviews.title: Terrrible reception staff, good location.

reviews.text: We spent 5 nights here at the beginning of Nov. Arrived at 9am but understandably the room was not ready yet, took a walk then came back and waited in lobby area for room. Staff on reception said they would call us when it was ready. After waiting for over an hour I asked again - the room had been ready for over half an hour and we had been left sat in the lobby. The room itself (a deluxe on the 19th floor) was excellent. Was very impressed with size, decor, facilities etc. Also the pool, jacuzzi facilities etc were excellent. Again though the staff lower my opinion of this hotel; on more than 2 or 3 occasssions I could get no answer from reception, even though they had posted a note asking me to contact them to arrange to refill the mini bar - this was never done. We ordered breakfast in bed which arrived on time and looked great but was stone cold. Again when I tried to phone somebody about this - no answer. I couldn't even get the huge trolley it came on removed from our room (I got through on the phone later in the afternoon and told them I had left it in the corridor). It remained there for 24hrs. At check out I informed the staff that I had tried lots but had not been able to get the mini bar refilled and had used approx $45. They told me it didn't matter and I wouldn't be charged. Because of this I didn't complain about the breakfast (which cost approx $75). I paid for my phone calls (I had a faulty phone or something went wrong disconnecting a call at reception so lost 40mins on an international phone card), and left. When I got back to the uk I had been charged the $45 dollars too! I must say that not all staff were poor; the guys who open the doors, collect and deliver luggage were pleasant, helpful and a credit to the hotel. There doesn't seem to be any conatct details on the web page and I don't really want to be phoning australia to complain about my problems, so will just have to put this one down to experience. This hotel is really nice and could be one of the best in sydney, but the customer service side of things needs to improve greatly.
reviews.title: Enjoyed this hotel - quite contemporary!
A long way to go
reviews.text: While travelling here on business, I decided to take a good weekend rate for a corner king room. The hotel is modern and has a very contemporary feel. Checking in was good, no issues or delay. I was assigned a corner room on the 25th floor which had a nice view of downtown. Reading the prior reviews, I was ready to see lots of dust. Somehow, this room did not have that issue. The marble bathroom with seperate tub and shower was a nice touch. The corner room had nice room to spread out. The only improvement here would be to equip the room with a tv that's larger than 20 inches. Then again, my purpose for coming is not to look at tv all day, but rather to take advantage of the hotel's central location. The gym on the 3rd level is average. I have scene better elsewhere, plus no ellliptical exercise machine. I'd stay here again in the future.

reviews.title: Very good service and location
reviews.text: Booked an Executive Club king room for $270 per night. For this, you get a room on a high floor and access to the club lounge with drinks and canapes from 5:30pm to 7:30pm and continental breakfast.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was a little leery after seeing some other reviews, but our experience at the Amora Sydney was quite positive. The location is perfect for easy access to Circular Quay, the Opera House, and the ferries. Front desk personnel were friendly and helpful, and our room was comfortable and clean. Prices at the hotel restaurants were very high, but we found many acceptable alternatives within walking distance of the hotel.
reviews.title: A Good Place to Stay in Sydney
The Best Hotel!
reviews.text: I would not hestitate to stay here again and would recommend the Amora to anyone looking to stay in Sydney's central business district.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great service, great rooms, great bathrooms, great food! A great overnight stay!
reviews.title: Good Hotel

reviews.text: We stayed in the Jamison for 8 nights over the week the hotel changed from Rydges to Amora.
reviews.title: Very good Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is excellent, just 5 mins to Circular Quay/The Rocks and 10 mins to Darling Harbour. We found the staff to be very helpful, particularly the concierge team. Our standard room was very spacious and the bathroom was superb. If we were being uber-critical the tele was in a silly position but you don't go to Sydney to watch the tv.
reviews.title: Good hotel, great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked 2 nights via wotif.com with their mystery hotel deals and lucked out with the Jamison. The room was clean and comfy with all the amenities we could need and a huge comfy bed. The staff we're very friendly and attentive which considering we were paying below rack rate and booked on the net is a great sign of a quality hotel. The location in great for access to the Rocks and Circular Quay and the Sydney CBD plus it's a stones throw from Wynyard station for people wanting to use public transport. What a great experience.
reviews.title: Relaxing luxury and great service

reviews.text: I spent a night at the Jamison as a "mystery hotel" deal on wotif.com which meant I paid a little less - about $70.00 less - than the standard rates. I'm glad I didn't pay the full rate (but I don't usually stay at corporate style hotels anyway and a hotel room over $250 has to offer something very special).
reviews.title: Good standard type CBD hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is very well located in the Sydney CBD, near Wynyard station, Circular Quay and shops. Staff were friendly and very helpful. I didn't use the restaurant or the public areas such as the bar or swimming pool so can only comment on the room. My room had a glimpse of the harbour, the bed was supremely comfortable, nice deco style bathroom. The decor of the room was a little odd, perhaps a slight nod to the deco era (1930s), it had a curious cupboard arrangement with lots of different compartments, not a bad idea but the exterior was clunky and awkward looking. The grey/green walls gave the room a rather cool institutional feel - I'm not sure but there was something not quite right with the interior design elements of the room. Other rooms are decorated differently by the looks of the hotel website. I may be a little fussy about this sort of thing, but it does make a difference.
reviews.title: Better than the reviews stated

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: At first was put off by the negative reviews of this hotel. Purchased via a web deal and was pleasantly surprised. Good location, close to public transport and trains. The room was clean, a bit tired, lacked an LCD tv but we were on a break and didn,t use it often. The bed was very comfortable. Service was great. All up pleasantly surprised and would definitely stay again.
reviews.title: A lovely hotel but difficult for wheelchair users being at the top of a hill

reviews.text: The Amora was a lovely hotel which offered valet parking for $48/night or self parking for $38/night. Worked out expensive when staying for a few nights. The carpark not the easist to access either. If they did a parking/accomm package it would be better value. The room was wheelchair accessible with not much room to move. The door was hard to open especially if in a manual wheelchair. Trying to keep it open whilst getting through it, proved to be quite a challenge for my fiance, as it was very heavy. The toilet also needed to be lower to be user friendly when in a shower chair. The bed was a comfy king size and there was a pillow menu for you to order your desired pillows. Had a great sleep whilst there. The only thing was the location. At the top of a hill so hard work for manual wheelchair users!!
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was VERY dissapointing. Firstly we were not informed of the hotel's change of name and spent 15 minutes trying to locate it! The room itself (a large corner room) was spacious, but filthy. Stains on the chairs, duvet cover and floor, dust on the telephone and bedside tables. The only redeeming factor was the bathroom which was superb with a big deep bath. None of our power points worked and we were told to flick the trip switch to activate the room's electricity. Also tv and alarm clock were of a very poor standard for what promises to be a luxery hotel. The bed was not made very well - twisted sheets - what looked like a rushed job. Our bags took forever to arrive and the stink of stale smoke (even though a non-smoking room was requested) was disgusting. For the cost of the room (a reduced internet rate of $245) this hotel was definitely NOT worth it. I am just glad we spent minimal time in this horrid room - only staying 1 night, opting for somewhere else the following night.
reviews.title: NOT a fan of this Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would NEVER reccommend this hotel to anyone.
reviews.title: Neat, comfortable and good value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is a city stop-over pad. The decor is modern and rooms are well-maintained with comfortable bed and excellent bathroom, albeit the room was a little small. The pool was not large but reasonable for a hotel in the CBD. It was pretty good value relative to other hotels nearby.
reviews.title: Good location, staff let it down
Fantastic!
reviews.text: We had 5 nights at this hotel. We arrived really early in the morning from London and not surprisingly no rooms were available at that time. The staff were pretty unhelpful, but we did get a shower in the swimming pool changing rooms. When we eventually returned to the hotel at 5pm we were given a smoking room despite having booked a non-smoking room weeks before. This in unnacceptable in my view, how can none be available when booked so far in advance? We had to wait an hour to have the bags brought to the room and it took a reminder phone call at that.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room itself was on the top floor and well appointed with nice views. The bathroom was good too. The gym was a disgrace and the equipment had not been maintained or cleaned in weeks. It was filthy and not a good recommendation. On the plus side, the location was excellent and within walking distance of everywhere in the city. Rydges was due to be taken over by another hotel group at the beginning of November. I hope they do better
reviews.title: Fab location-hotel just ok

reviews.text: I have the misfortune to be staying at this hotel. It is dirty and hot. The only concession that they have offered to me is to give me a fan in my room, which does help, but in the heat of Sydney I would have expected the AC to work a little better than it does. This hotel tries to be a designer hotel but it isn't. The rooms are small and hot, it has very annoying touch switches for all the lights which are, well, annoying and very seventies. The internet is very slow, my room was cleaned today and all the dirty towels are still in my bath where they were left by the maid. I'm here because my company is paying, but you can do a lot better in Sydney for the money.
reviews.title: One of the worst hotels in the world

reviews.text: Room comfortable, there is even a toaster, bathroom is very well appointed with a great bath. I enjoyed the room apart from the internet access.
reviews.title: Great apart from the internet

reviews.text: If you are here on business and are going to be spending your time in the room working rather than holidaying then the internet access is a serious problem.
reviews.title: Great hotel & great location.

reviews.text: No wireless, ethernet cable connection only. I carry a travel router so that I can setup my own wireless for my laptop and smartphone t connect to.
reviews.title: Great location, excellent service

reviews.text: Its described as high speed broadband but it tests out as 256kb down / 56kb up with a ping of over 400milliseconds.
reviews.title: Dissapointing

reviews.text: Hotel is in a good location but the room is dated - not quite 5-star IMO. No free Wi-Fi, no iPod dock (a ticking clock on the bed side table instead!), old style TV (eg not flat screen), old gym equipments.
reviews.title: Dated room

reviews.text: Booked with wotif, Rude front desk manager, all but accused me off lieing regarding our booking, Was tempted to leave . Will never stay here again, In Sydney we are spoilt for chioce...several 5 stay hotels stay at another one... I have stayed at this hotel befor will never stay again.
reviews.title: Unfriendly rude fronte desk staff.

reviews.text: We booked a secret hotel on lastminute.com for a 5 star hotel. Hotel lobby is really nice but that's about it. Rooms are struggling to be 4 star, with faded quilt covers, basic room furniture and a tv that looks like it's from the 90's. Haven't slept in it yet tonight but not looking forward to it.
reviews.title: Not 5 star at all

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Booked this mystery five star - not five star rooms. Given a disabled room on 4th floor. Air con. also disabled and room stifling. Given a wheelchair disabled room on 5th floor. Were made to feel like second class citizens because we booked through Wotif! Admirable to have rooms for the disabled -but we did not need this facility. Honeymoon stuff not! The rooms were three star and tired. I saw better tv sets on the verge collection. The location of the hotel is great, and there may be great rooms, however not what you get when you take a misery mystery booking through Wotif!!
reviews.title: what if we had a decent room - wotif?

reviews.text: Got this deal on a Wotif mystery deal and it was advertised as a 5 star hotel. It is in a great location but the front office staff were very unfriendly and uninformative! The room was ok but the desk had a large stain on it and we had an already filled out breakfast menu in the room. Upon check out the front office staff were once again unfriendly and especially rude as front office was busy and she was rushing out check out. Our complaint card was filled in and they said a response would be sent out which it hasn't. Would not pay full price to stay at this hotel wasn't even worth the discounted rate! the Travelodge around the corner was better value with much friendlier staff!!
reviews.title: No where near 5 star service!

reviews.text: Stayed here as part of our world trip and whilst some time ago just wanted to add my thoughts. The room and bathroom were of a high standard and the service was of high quality throughout. Unknown to ourselves, some friends had arranged a suprise bottle of champagne and some other gifts with the hotel staff prior to our arrival and no-one let on, a great acting job by the bellboy who told us later he had been the one to set up the whole thing. Very nice suprise on entering the room and all just added to the friendly feeling we got from the hotel staff.
reviews.title: Yep, great hotel in an overrated city

reviews.text: The restaurant was very nice and had a stunning waterfall feature. Breakfast was enjoyed there throughout our 9 day stay.
reviews.title: Highly recommended hotel just off Circular Quay
Number One for Sydney
reviews.text: Couldn't fault the hotel, one of the best we stayed in thoughout our world tour. Have to say though that Sydney was a big disappointment, could have seen it in 3 or 4 days not 9.

reviews.title: For the jetlagged traveler!
reviews.text: 'London by the sea'.

I stayed in this hotel for five nights in March. This is a boutique hotel with contemporary designs and the rooms are minimalist with their furnishings. The bedroom facilities were superb, with proper cartons of milk for tea and coffee rather than the usual single serve variety. I still haven't figured out why I'd want a toaster in my room though! The bathroom was to die for - huge shower, decent bath, large sink area with lots of storage. The hotel staff were really friendly and efficient. I had a friend joining me as a surprise to the others in our party and, although he checked in ahead of me, the staff kept the surprise by not letting on, right up to the springing of the surprise in the bar. The location of the hotel is excellent - 10 minutes walk from Circular Quay and down a side street so there isn't much through traffic. It's located above a metro station too. Highly recommended - I'd definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Great stay!!!!

reviews.text: Everything about the Amora Jamison is perfect, great location, the rooms are comfortable and well fitted out. (they even have a pillow menu) Staff are always very attentive
reviews.title: Perfect!

likes.liked: — the customer service, and the fresh squeezed orange juice

reviews.text: Their restaurant is just as good, I had breakfast there and it was expensive but worth it. Freshly squeezed juice topped it all off.
reviews.title: Classy Accommodation

reviews.text: Really nice hotel in fabulous location. 4 blocks to Opera House area, easy walking distance to all major attractions. Nice attention to detail. Very comfortable beds. Fabulous soaker tub. Internet is plug in for $30/day or $50/week. Buffet breakfast was disappointing.
reviews.title: wonderful stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked our stay via Expedia from the Uk based on much research and previous traveller reviews. We were not disappointed. From check in to check out we had a wonderful stay. Our rooms and bathrooms were spotlessly clean, well equipped and had fantastic views. Slippers and robes were a nice touch.Taking the club rooms and club lounge option was certainly worth the extra. A delightful haven to begin the day with breakfast or start the evening with drinks and canapes.
reviews.title: Good location/ Nice Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Attentive and well informed staff. Parking was an issue but a valet dealt with that for us even though the rates were a little steep. I suppose it is right in the city centre after all!
reviews.title: Stayed here for the Sydney Marathon and loved it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights from 10th August. Booked the hotel on the basis of reviews that we had read on this site and delighted to say that we were not disappointed. We arrived about 8pm after a flight from Hong Kong and the reception staff arranged for our luggage to go straight to the room whilst we went straight to the bar for an extremely welcome complimentary glass of champagne (and a smoke!). Sorted! we didn't get to the room till 1am but what a great start to our stay! We thought the room was perfectly appointed and spotless. The TV wasn't great but hey, we don't go on holiday to watch TV. The bathroom was fantastic. Only had one meal at the hotel - the seafood buffet on the Saturday night - excellent & the desserts must have been too 'cos my partner ate NINE!!!! The cafe next door was ideal for breakfast tho' unfortunately isn't open on the weekends but loads of other eateries in the area. Location of hotel ideal - walking distance everywhere and that includes Paddy's Market, Botanical Gardens and Darling Harbour etc. The hotel and area had everything we needed (didn't have time to use the hotel pool so can't comment on that), the staff were the most helpful and the friendliest we have encountered so far. In particular, the bar staff - Ngar, Laura & Laura who enlivened our nightcaps no end, so much so that we ran up quite a bar bill!!!! but it was worth it! We have already decided that we will always stay there whenever we are in Sydney which at the mo seems to be every 2 years! Can't wait!
reviews.title: Fabulous!!!

reviews.text: This hotel was the best hotel ever stayed in. We upgraded to Club deluxe room which are on top 3 floors. This upgrade was worth every penny, giving you best rooms, e.g. large bathroom with bath overlooking city, playstation, but best of all you get access to exclusive club lounge on 31st floor getting complimentary drinks ..champagne if you want + canopies(e.g.sushi, chicken skewers) 5:30-7:30 every night. You can use the lounge for breakfast also. Request corner room to give dual aspects of city. Concierge couldn't do enough. Sydney itself was fantastic, disagree with previous reviewer who said London by the sea. Sydney is much better, friendly, laid back & nobody is out to stuff you. I would recommend doing bridge climb £70, the aquarium, ferry to Manly (walk through town to Manly beach) turn right down to Shelly beach. Eat Barramundi takeaway from Manly fish market & eat on beach. In the rocks try G'day cafe for lunch & Zia Pina dinner for good food well priced. Doyles for special dinner. Rocks market sat/sun. Paddys market for very cheap clothes....chinese imports. Opera house tour was good. Hope this helps.
reviews.title: Fantastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just returned from a three week stay in Australia and spent the first week in Sydney staying at the Rydges Jamison. We chose this hotel partly because of the excellent reviews on Trip Advisor and partly because of the impressive hotel website. We used the hotel's own website to make the reservation - using a combination of a weekend rate and a weekday rate for the best deal. We booked a room with a balcony but unfortunely it did not have much of a view. It was handy to be able to open the doors for fresh air rather than use the air conditioning. The hotel is situated in the business district of Sydney and is only five minutes walk from Circular Quay where we were able to pick up ferries and bus tours. The staff were all very friendly and helpful - we used the concierge service to book a couple of tours. The rooms spacious and clean. Dined at the hotel restaurants on two separate evenings and used the dining room for the buffet breakfast at the weekend. No complaints. Plenty of excellent restaurants locally and on a week day a fabulous food court just next to the hotel served a great selection of foods/fruits and drinks for breakfast for under AU$10 for two people. All in all an excellent stay.
reviews.title: Very enjoyable stay. Highly recommended.

likes.liked: — Central. Rooms very clean and comfortable.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rydges was a great place to stay in Sydney! It is close to everything and everyone was very helpful. They set up all of our excursions and gave us helpful advice on what to do. It is only a 5 minute walk to the Quay. I stayed there alone for one night before my husband arrived and I felt completely safe walking around late at night. I would stay there again if I ever have the chance to return.
reviews.title: Great hotel!!

likes.liked: — very helful staff and clean accomodations

reviews.title: Great hotel
reviews.text: Great location in the heart of sydney close to Circular Quay. Our room was big and has a great bathroom - absolutely spotless.

reviews.title: Great hotel
reviews.text: Ate in the bar one night and food was good if a bit expensive but I guess you expect that in Sydney!!
Friendly and helpful staff who booked restaurant tables for us etc. and checked us in early morning after a long flight!!!
reviews.title: A Fabulous Place to Stay!
Fantastic Location
reviews.text: Small Gym but decent pool.

reviews.title: Huge beds!
reviews.text: I stay at the Amora 4-5 times a year as my company's Sydney office is just around the corner. The rooms are very attractively furnished, although not huge. The bathrooms are also very nice. But my favourite aspect is the bed - I'm very tall and the Amora's beds are so big I can almost sleep sideways in them.
Some rooms have fairly decent harbour vierws, although far from unobstructed.
reviews.title: An almost 5* experience

reviews.text: The TVs could do with being updated - 4:3 CRTs really aren't good enough these days.
reviews.title: Great stay - think I scored an upgrade

likes.disliked: — I didn't get to stay long enough

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I usually pay approx $210-230, but it's booked through my company's travel agent, so rates are outside my control.
reviews.title: Very disappointed
Last Minute Treat
reviews.text: In summary, for a place where I usually check in at about 9pm and check out at 7am the next morning, it's perfectly adequate.
Hotel staff are polite and attentive. Room was above average.
reviews.title: attentive staff

reviews.text: One of the few 5-star hotels in Sydney CBD that provides self-parking on the premises. This is a bonus if you do not trust strangers to park your car.
reviews.title: Lovely!

likes.liked: — blackout blinds in rooms, rooms in general were fabulous

reviews.text: One warning is that there is a beggar in the vicinity of the hotel. He was abusive and threatening as I walked alone to the hotel. When I mentioned it to the door-men they didn't seem to care, they just smiled at me... During my stay at the hotel, I saw this beggar hanging around and whenever I was leaving and arriving at the hotel I was constantly concerned for my own safety.
reviews.title: Good Enough For Us!

reviews.text: Hotel is 5 star. Amazin hotel rooms what you would expect from 5 star. very modern and new. The pool is lovely although the gym is quite small. The reception staff are lovely and there are plenty of bars and hotels to chose from within the hotel. Excellent location, wtihin walkting distance to all the shops, circular quay and darling harbour.
reviews.title: Very Bad Service

reviews.text: I was booked to this hotel through a secret deal on a certain website.After reading a few reviews I was a little worried what to expect! I believe it comes down to what you expect in a hotel,and previous experiences in 5 star. I rarely travel,so the thought of a 5star hotel in sydney sounded good.My daughter (7) and I stayed overnight in a deluxe king room.We traveled by train to wynyard station and is only a street away walking.On arrival,the door was opened with a "welcome to the amora" the girls at front desk were polite and showed us how to use the cards for the elevator and rooms.Our room was on floor 17.I found the rooms spacious enough,HUGE king size comfortable bed,well stocked bar fridge,tv,robes,slippers,guides to sydney,very nice bathroom with deep tub,seperate shower,shower gel\shampoo\cond\hand lotion. Our room looked into the other buildings with glimpses of the water,but if you stay in the CBD you just expect that and being from the country it was fine with us to check out the city. We had a light dinner at the Gallery and was nice.Breakfast for a buffet is $33,but there is a food court practically underneath,with every kind of eatery you could wish for.Also a cafe next door advertising full breakfast and coffee for $12.50.Location - Perfect! A short walk to circular quay\botanic gardens\ferries\trains etc was excellent.We explored the hotel pool which we thought was nice with a sauna\steam room\spa as well,and the beauty room.Did not use these but seemed very relaxing.Other reviews say about times with this hotel.Yes the pool\restaurants etc are open certain times, so if this is important to you doesnt it make sense to find this stuff out before you go?Anyway we loved it,and the service,I think if you have a smile,they will too.
reviews.title: Everthing was perfect!

description: From the moment you arrive at our 5 Star luxury hotel in Sydney, you’ll experience the Amora difference.This award winning 5 Star hotel in Sydney combines space, style and warmth to provide the ultimate ambience for business travel or holiday pleasure.There are 415 stylish guest rooms, two restaurants and two bars offering exceptional wining and dining facilities, seven meetings and conference rooms and a dedicated relaxation zone incorporating Amora Day Spa, a heated indoor swimming pool, steam room, sauna, jacuzzi and gym.Amora Hotel Jamison Sydney is located next to Wynyard Train Station just a 10-minute walk from Circular Quay, Sydney Opera House, Harbour Bridge and The Rocks. The city’s best shopping, dining and nightlife are on the hotel’s doorstep.
